au.com.bytecode.opencsv
Class CSV

java.lang.Object
  au.com.bytecode.opencsv.CSV

public class CSV
extends java.lang.Object

A very simple CSV format container. It allows to construct CSVReader and CSVWriter objects. Also it provides helper methods to read and write CSV. Example: 

 // define CSV format 
    CSV csv = CSV
          .separator(',')
          .skipLines(1)
          .create();
		
    // write CSV file
    csv.write("example.csv", new CSVWriteProc() {
        public void process(CSVWriter out) {
            out.writeNext("Col1", "Col2");
            out.writeNext("Val1", "Val2");
        }
    });
		
    // read CSV file
    csv.read("example.csv", new CSVReadProc() {
        public void procRow(int rowIndex, String... values) {
            System.out.println(Arrays.asList(values));
        }
    });

Author:
Dmitry Sanatin

strictQuotes

public static CSV.Builder strictQuotes()
Constructs CSVBuilder. Characters outside the quotes will be ignored.

notStrictQuotes

public static CSV.Builder notStrictQuotes()
Constructs CSVBuilder. Characters outside the quotes will not be ignored.

ignoreLeadingWhiteSpace

public static CSV.Builder ignoreLeadingWhiteSpace()
Constructs CSVBuilder. White space before a quote in a field will be ignored.

public static CSV.Builder notIgnoreLeadingWhiteSpace()
